title: Duplicate extraction files with inconsistent naming

description.problem: Extraction script creates duplicate files with inconsistent filename normalization, resulting in both lowercase_underscores and camelCase versions of the same node
description.impact: CRITICAL - 287 duplicate file groups (574 total files) wasting ~14MB disk space and creating confusion about which file has correct data
description.root_cause: Extraction script runs with inconsistent filename normalization between runs. Some extractions normalize to lowercase_with_underscores, others preserve camelCase from node names
evidence: ciscoWebex: both ciscoWebex_data.json AND ciscowebex_data.json exist
actionNetwork: both actionnetwork_data.json AND actionNetwork_data.json exist
Total: 772 files instead of expected ~530 files
Comparison shows ciscowebex_data.json has better quality (parsed defaults, outputs, group) vs ciscoWebex_data.json (raw strings)
2025-11-07 manual spot-check: hubspot_data.json contains parsed defaults/outputs while HubSpot_data.json still has defaults serialized as a string and outputs stored as "[NodeConnectionTypes.Main]"
description.fix_approach:
1. Implement consistent filename normalization at start of extraction
2. Use cleanup_duplicates.py to remove existing duplicates (keeping better quality version)
3. Add deduplication check before file write to prevent future duplicates
